hiragana.__comment_count: Specifies starting and ending unicode hex as well as length of the whole map.
hiragana.__comment_array: Columns: (small mora, gojuon mora, dakuten mora, handakuten mora) x5 as groups (a, i, u, e, o).
hiragana.__comment_smallPrefix: Specifies prefix for typing small morae in this object.
hiragana.__comment_supportedSmallPrefix: Specifies supported prefixes for writing small morae.
hiragana.__comment_except: Array of morae to always, indiscriminately ignore in any parsing.
hiragana.__comment_map_overview: Map of additional data for every mora in array.
hiragana.__comment_romaji: Actual representation of how to write this mora.
hiragana.__comment_map_forSokuon: Morae used to write double consonant, e.g. `tte` has small `tsu` and `te`, where small `tsu` is a sokuon.
hiragana.__comment_map_forYoon: Morae used to write different sounds with a palatalized mora, e.g. `hya` uses palatalized `h` with `i` at the end and small `ya` that forms yoon.
hiragana.__comment_map_forChoonpu: Morae used to elongate the previous vowel, e.g. `okaasan` is comprised of 5 morae, where 3rd is a choonpu.
hiragana.__comment_map_canSokuon: Dictates that this mora can be modified with sokuon, e.g. `te` can have a sokuon at the beggining, thus forming `tte`.
hiragana.__comment_map_canYoon: Dictates that this mora can be modified into a yoon, e.g. `hi` can have a small `ya` at the end, this forming `hya`.
